body: How would you suggest fixing it?
@samdark  create simple mailer - [`mb_send_mail()` wrapper](https://github.com/eoghanobrien/php-simple-mail) or add `yiisoft/yii2-swiftmailer` to package dependencies
You're right that it's not a good practice but I'm afraid we can't change that without breaking existing apps.
Can't we just add yii2-swiftmailer in the `suggest` section of the composer.json?
@bizley @samdark by default, we can't use `Yii::$app->mailer` without `yii2-swiftmailer`
Yes, but this is not an error. I would add it in suggested so when developer installs dependencies it can be displayed as a suggestion. And who wants to add can add it.

Please bear in mind that not everybody uses SwiftMailer, even if it's regarded within the framework. 
For example I have to use [PhpMailer](https://github.com/PHPMailer/PHPMailer) instead of SwiftMailer, because it allows much easier composing mailbody for delayed async posting from database mailqueue.

issue.title: yii\base\Application: fix mailer

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

body:
Swiftmailer will stop being maintained at the end of November 2021.

Please, move to Symfony Mailer at your earliest convenience. Symfony Mailer is the next evolution of Swiftmailer. It provides the same features with support for modern PHP code and support for third-party providers.

https://github.com/swiftmailer/swiftmailer/blob/master/README.md
Done for Yii 3: https://github.com/yiisoft/mailer-symfony. Could be back-ported.
